page.title: 10THE MODERN WATER SUPPLY.
page.content: When it was discovered that a bore hole supplying Whaley Water Works had become polluted it became necessary to find an alternate source. As a temporary measure water was drawn from Manton Colliery and purified at Whaley before being distributed as before. Work was planned to lay a pipe-line to carry water from Ogston Reservoir to the city of Sheffield. It was decided to put in a spur from the pipe-line at Calow which would bring water from Ogston to supply the Bolsover area. After this work was completed the Whaley Water Works was closed. Although no longer in use the buildings and purification equipment remain.
